messages.message: [Prod] Hey, there seems to be a bug with the tab naming in Chrome. Whichever project I go into has the same name `AI Hub: AAnG Sandbox - Build: My Hub: MagMutual Sandbox - Build` . The correct project is MagMutual Sandbox
it seems like the `PageTitle` s are appending to each other, instead of replacing each other? have you seen this before? @Travis

based on the docs (https://github.com/nfl/react-helmet?tab=readme-ov-file#example) for `react-helmet`, it seems like a nested `title` element should override its ancestors

is the fix to remove `titleTemplate` from here (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/2d5821a/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/main.tsx#L95)?
hmm i’m not able to reproduce this bug in my local environment or on aihub.instabase.com (http://aihub.instabase.com) :confused_dog:
@Hamish are you still able to reproduce this issue on prod? if so, can you describe the steps you took to reproduce?

@Serena Thanks for checking this! Once I refreshed the page it fixed the problem and I'm not able to reproduce. I had the same experience earlier today but managed to encounter the bug again a second time
I'll let you know if I see it again
recently I had re-arranged the page title with the Site title. But otherwise I have no input on what’s going on.
This is still happening - but I am still clueless as to what is causing it. I actually had 3 project names stack together this time
do you have any reproducing steps?

I've just been building demos in Build/Converse and occasionally when I go to change tabs I see the result. When I try to recreate it though I can't figuring out which of the many actions caused it though
Sorry I realise thats really unhelpful
I have a hunch that there might be some routes with multiple PageTitle calls which causes it to stack.
